db:article.db:para: The fundamental behavior of qmake is influenced by variable declarations that define the build process of each project. Some of these declare resources, such as headers and source files, that are common to each platform. Others are used to customize the behavior of compilers and linkers on specific platforms.

Platform-specific variables follow the naming pattern of the variables which they extend or modify, but include the name of the relevant platform in their name. For example, a makespec may use QMAKE_LIBS to specify a list of libraries that each project needs to link against, and QMAKE_LIBS_X11 would be used to extend this list.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_ABIS

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of Android target ABIs. Valid values are: armeabi-v7a, arm64-v8a, x86, x86_64.
You can provide the ABIs as a qmake argument:

db:note.db:para: It is possible to use this variable inside the *.pro file, however, it is not recommended since it will override any ABIs specified on the qmake command line.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_API_VERSION

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the Android API level number. For more information, see Android Build Numbers.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_APPLICATION_ARGUMENTS

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies extra command-line arguments to the Android app using the AndroidManifest.xml with the tag "android.app.arguments". This takes a string of arguments:

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_BUNDLED_JAR_DEPENDENCIES

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android modules.

db:section.db:para: This is useful when writing a Qt module. It specifies a list of pre-bundled dependencies used by the module in a .jar format, for example:

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_DEPLOYMENT_DEPENDENCIES

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: By default, androiddeployqt will detect the dependencies of your application. However, since run-time usage of plugins cannot be detected, there could be false positives, as your application might depend on any plugin that is a potential dependency. If you want to minimize the size of your APK, it's possible to override the automatic detection using the this variable. This should contain a list of all Qt files which need to be included, with paths relative to the Qt install root.

db:note.db:para: Only the Qt files specified with this variable are included. Failing to include all the correct files can result in crashes. It's also important to make sure the files are listed in the correct loading order. This variable provides a way to override the automatic detection entirely, so if a library is listed before its dependencies, it will fail to load on some devices.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_DEPLOYMENT_SETTINGS_FILE

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the path to the android-deployment-settings.json file needed by androiddeployqt and androidtestrunner. This overrides the path to the settings file generated by qmake, thus you have to make sure to provide a valid settings file.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_EXTRA_LIBS

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: A list of external libraries that will be copied into your application's libs folder and loaded on start-up. This can be used, for instance, to enable OpenSSL in your application. For more information, see Adding OpenSSL Support for Android.
To include external libraries for multiple ABIs, where each ABIs has its own directory, use the following:
Otherwise, if the ABI is included in the library name, use the following:

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_EXTRA_PLUGINS

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a path to C++ plugins or resources that your application has to bundle but that cannot be delivered through the assets system, such as QML plugins. With this variable, androiddeployqt will make sure everything is packaged and deployed properly.

ANDROID_EXTRA_PLUGINS must point to the directory where the extra plugin(s) are built. In addition, the build directory structure must follow a naming convention similar to Qt plugins, that is, plugins/<plugin name>.
The plugins libraries should have the name format libplugins_<type>_<name>_<abi>.so. To achieve that the plugin pro file could be defined as follows:
db:section.db:programlisting:
TEMPLATE = lib CONFIG += plugin
PLUGIN_TYPE = imageformats DESTDIR = $$top_builddir/plugins/myplugin TARGET = $$qt5LibraryTarget(myplugin, "plugins/$$PLUGIN_TYPE/")
db:section.db:para: with top_builddir defined in .qmake.conf as:
This will ensure that the correct name mangling is applied to the plugin library (plugins/myplugin/libplugins_imageformats_myplugin_armeabi-v7a.so).
Then, assuming an extra image format plugin myplugin is built as $$DESTDIR/plugins/myplugin/, the following ensures it is packaged correctly:

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_FEATURES

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android modules.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a module's features list:
For more information, see Android <uses-feature> Docs.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_LIB_DEPENDENCIES

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android modules.

db:section.db:para: This is useful when writing a Qt module. It specifies a list of pre-built dependencies used by the module, for example:

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_MIN_SDK_VERSION

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the minimum Android API level for the project. By default, this variable is set to API level 23.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_PACKAGE_SOURCE_DIR

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the path for a custom Android package template. The Android package template contains:

db:listitem.db:para: build.gradle file and other Gradle scripts

db:section.db:para: The path specified by this variable can contain custom Java classes under src directory. By default, the androiddeployqt tool copies the application template from the Qt for Android installation path into your project's build directory, then it copies the contents of the path specified by this variable on top of that, overwriting any existing files. For instance, you can make a custom AndroidManifest.xml for your application, then place this directly into the directory specified by this variable.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_PERMISSIONS

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android modules.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a module's permissions list:
For more information, see Android <uses-permission> Docs.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_TARGET_SDK_VERSION

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the target Android API level for the project. By default, this variable is set to API level 35.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_VERSION_CODE

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the application's version number. For more information, see Android App Versioning.

db:section.db:title: ANDROID_VERSION_NAME

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the application's version in as a human readable string. For more information, see Android App Versioning.

db:section.db:title: CONFIG
db:section.db:para: Specifies project configuration and compiler options. The values are recognized internally by qmake and have special meaning.

db:note.db:para: The values are case-sensitive.

db:section.db:para: The following CONFIG values control compiler and linker flags:

db:td.db:para: The project is to be built in release mode. If debug is also specified, the last one takes effect.
The project is to be built in debug mode.
The project is prepared to be built in both debug and release modes.
This option is set by default. If debug_and_release is also set, the debug and release builds end up in separate debug and release directories.
If debug_and_release is specified, the project is built in both debug and release modes by default.
Automatically generates a .cpp file that includes the precompiled header file specified in the .pro file.
When using the subdirs template, this option specifies that the directories listed should be processed in the order in which they are given.

db:note.db:para: The use of this option is discouraged. Specify dependencies as described in the SUBDIRS variable documentation.

db:td.db:para: Enables support for the use of precompiled headers in projects.
Enables support for the use of precompiled headers for C files.
The compiler should output as many warnings as possible. If warn_off is also specified, the last one takes effect.
The compiler should output as few warnings as possible.
Exception support is enabled. Set by default.
Link time code generation is enabled. This option is off by default.
RTTI support is enabled. By default, the compiler default is used.
RTTI support is disabled. By default, the compiler default is used.
STL support is enabled. By default, the compiler default is used.
STL support is disabled. By default, the compiler default is used.
Thread support is enabled. This is enabled when CONFIG includes qt, which is the default.
Specifies that the project's source files does not use the UTF-8 encoding. Instead, the compiler default is used.
Set the default visibility of symbols in the binary to hidden. By default, the compiler default is used.
C99 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C99, or can't select the C standard. By default, the compiler default is used.
C11 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C11, or can't select the C standard. By default, the compiler default is used.
C17, also known as C18, support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C17, or can't select the C standard. By default, the compiler default is used.
This is an alias for the c17 value.
Disables support for C compiler extensions. By default, they are enabled.
C++11 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C++11, or can't select the C++ standard. By default, support is enabled.
C++14 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C++14, or can't select the C++ standard. By default, support is enabled.
C++17 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C++17, or can't select the C++ standard. By default, support is enabled.
C++20 support is enabled. This option has no effect if the compiler does not support C++20, or can't select the C++ standard. By default, support is disabled.

Support for the latest C++ language standard is enabled. This option is mostly useful for MSVC that supports a /std:c++latest compiler argument. For other toolchains, this option enables the latest C++ standard that is known to Qt. By default, this option is disabled.
Disables support for C++ compiler extensions. By default, they are enabled.
Appending the value of INCLUDEPATH to DEPENDPATH is enabled. Set by default.

Run lrelease for all files listed in TRANSLATIONS and EXTRA_TRANSLATIONS. If embed_translations is not set, install the generated .qm files into QM_FILES_INSTALL_PATH. Use QMAKE_LRELEASE_FLAGS to add options to the lrelease call. Not set by default.
Embed the generated translations from lrelease in the executable, under QM_FILES_RESOURCE_PREFIX. Requires lrelease to be set, too. Not set by default.
Create a libtool .la file for the currently built library.
Create a pkg-config .pc file for the currently built library.
NMake only: Turn off generation of NMake batch rules or inference rules.
Suppress the automatic version number appended to the DLL file name on Windows.
Suppress warnings of the VS project generator.
Automatically invoke windeployqt after linking, and add the output as deployment items.
Suppress qmake recursion for the current subproject.
Do not add the current directory to INCLUDEPATHS.
By default, qmake does not compile source files that are included in other source files. This option disables this behavior.

db:section.db:para: When you use the debug_and_release option (which is the default under Windows), the project will be processed three times: one time to produce a "meta" Makefile, and two more times to produce a Makefile.Debug and a Makefile.Release.
During the latter passes, build_pass and the respective debug or release option is appended to CONFIG. This makes it possible to perform build-specific tasks. For example:

As an alternative to manually writing build type conditionals, some variables offer build-specific variants, for example QMAKE_LFLAGS_RELEASE in addition to the general QMAKE_LFLAGS. These should be used when available.

The meta Makefile makes the sub-builds invokable via the debug and release targets, and a combined build via the all target. When the build_all CONFIG option is used, the combined build is the default. Otherwise, the last specified CONFIG option from the set (debug, release) determines the default. In this case, you can explicitly invoke the all target to build both configurations at once:

db:note.db:para: The details are slightly different when producing Visual Studio and Xcode projects.

db:section.db:para: When linking a library, qmake relies on the underlying platform to know what other libraries this library links against. However, if linking statically, qmake will not get this information unless we use the following CONFIG options:

db:td.db:para: This option enables qmake to track these dependencies. When this option is enabled, qmake will create a file with the extension .prl which will save meta-information about the library (see Library Dependencies for more info).
When this option is enabled, qmake will process all libraries linked to by the application and find their meta-information (see Library Dependencies for more info).
This option disables the generation of installation rules for generated .prl files.

db:note.db:para: The create_prl option is required when building a static library, while link_prl is required when using a static library.

db:section.db:para: The following options define the application or library type:

db:td.db:para: The target is a Qt application or library and requires the Qt library and header files. The proper include and library paths for the Qt library will automatically be added to the project. This is defined by default, and can be fine-tuned with the QT variable.
The target is an X11 application or library. The proper include paths and libraries will automatically be added to the project.
The target is an automated test. A check target will be added to the generated Makefile to run the test. Only relevant when generating Makefiles.
The exit code of the automated test will be ignored. Only relevant if testcase is also set.
The target is a Win32 window application (app only). The proper include paths, compiler flags and libraries will automatically be added to the project.

The target is a Win32 console application (app only). The proper include paths, compiler flags and libraries will automatically be added to the project. Consider using the option cmdline for cross-platform applications.
The target is a cross-platform command line application. On Windows, this implies CONFIG += console. On macOS, this implies CONFIG -= app_bundle.

The target is a shared object/DLL. The proper include paths, compiler flags and libraries will automatically be added to the project. Note that dll can also be used on all platforms; a shared library file with the appropriate suffix for the target platform (.dll or .so) will be created.
The target is a static library (lib only). The proper compiler flags will automatically be added to the project.
The target is a plugin (lib only). This enables dll as well.
The target is a plugin for Qt Widgets Designer.
Ensures that the list of libraries stored in the LIBS variable is not reduced to a list of unique values before it is used.
Create a <name>_metatypes.json file for the current project. <name> is the all lowercase base name of TARGET.

Automatically register QML types defined in C++. For more information, see Defining QML Types from C++. Also, create a <template>.qmltypes file for the current project. <template> will be plugins (plural, for historical reasons) if plugin is set, or the value of TEMPLATE otherwise. qmltypes implies metatypes.

db:section.db:para: These options define specific features on Windows only:

db:td.db:para: When using the vcapp template this will put all the source files into the source group and the header files into the header group regardless of what directory they reside in. Turning this option off will group the files within the source/header group depending on the directory they reside. This is turned on by default.
Embeds a manifest file in the DLL created as part of a library project.
Embeds a manifest file in the EXE created as part of an application project.

db:section.db:para: See Platform Notes for more information about the options for embedding manifest files.
The following options take an effect only on macOS:

db:td.db:para: Puts the executable into a bundle (this is the default).
Puts the library into a library bundle.
Puts the plugin into a plugin bundle. This value is not supported by the Xcode project generator.

db:section.db:para: The build process for bundles is also influenced by the contents of the QMAKE_BUNDLE_DATA variable.
The following options take an effect only on Linux/Unix platforms:

db:td.db:para: Puts debugging information for libraries in separate files.

db:section.db:para: The CONFIG variable will also be checked when resolving scopes. You may assign anything to this variable.
For example:

db:section.db:title: DEFINES
db:section.db:para: qmake adds the values of this variable as compiler C preprocessor macros (-D option).
For example:

db:section.db:title: DEFINES_DEBUG
db:section.db:para: Specifies preprocessor defines for the debug configuration. The values of this variable get added to DEFINES after the project is loaded. This variable is typically set in qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
This variable was introduced in Qt 5.13.2.

db:section.db:title: DEFINES_RELEASE
db:section.db:para: Specifies preprocessor defines for the release configuration. The values of this variable get added to DEFINES after the project is loaded. This variable is typically set in qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:note.db:para: For MSVC mkspecs, this variable contains the value NDEBUG by default.

db:section.db:para: This variable was introduced in Qt 5.13.2.

db:section.db:title: DEF_FILE

db:note.db:para: This variable is used only on Windows when using the app template.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a .def file to be included in the project.

db:section.db:title: DEPENDPATH
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of directories for qmake to scan, to resolve dependencies. This variable is used when qmake crawls through the header files that you #include in your source code.

db:section.db:title: DESTDIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies where to put the target file.
For example:

db:note.db:para: The list of supported characters can depend on the used build tool. In particular, parentheses do not work with make.

db:section.db:title: DISTFILES
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of files to be included in the dist target. This feature is supported by UnixMake specs only.
For example:

db:section.db:title: DLLDESTDIR

db:note.db:para: This variable applies only to Windows targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies where to copy the target dll.

db:section.db:title: EXTRA_TRANSLATIONS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of translation (.ts) files that contain translations of the user interface text into non-native languages.
In contrast to TRANSLATIONS, translation files in EXTRA_TRANSLATIONS will be processed only by lrelease, not lupdate.
You can use CONFIG += lrelease to automatically compile the files during the build, and CONFIG += lrelease embed_translations to make them available in The Qt Resource System.
See the Qt Linguist Manual for more information about internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) with Qt.

db:section.db:title: FORMS
db:section.db:para: Specifies the UI files (see Qt Widgets Designer Manual) to be processed by uic before compiling. All dependencies, headers and source files required to build these UI files will automatically be added to the project.
For example:

db:section.db:title: GUID
db:section.db:para: Specifies the GUID that is set inside a .vcproj file. The GUID is usually randomly determined. However, should you require a fixed GUID, it can be set using this variable.
This variable is specific to .vcproj files only; it is ignored otherwise.

db:section.db:title: HEADERS
db:section.db:para: Defines the header files for the project.
qmake automatically detects whether moc is required by the classes in the headers, and adds the appropriate dependencies and files to the project for generating and linking the moc files.
For example:
See also SOURCES.

db:section.db:title: ICON
db:section.db:para: This variable is used only on Mac OS to set the application icon. Please see the application icon documentation for more information.

db:section.db:title: IDLSOURCES
db:section.db:para: This variable is used only on Windows for the Visual Studio project generation to put the specified files in the Generated Files folder.

db:section.db:title: INCLUDEPATH
db:section.db:para: Specifies the #include directories which should be searched when compiling the project.
For example:
To specify a path containing spaces, quote the path using the technique described in Whitespace.

db:section.db:title: INSTALLS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of resources that will be installed when make install or a similar installation procedure is executed. Each item in the list is typically defined with attributes that provide information about where it will be installed.

For example, the following target.path definition describes where the build target will be installed, and the INSTALLS assignment adds the build target to the list of existing resources to be installed:
INSTALLS has a .CONFIG member that can take several values:

db:td.db:para: If not set, qmake looks to see if the files to install actually exist. If these files don't exist, qmake doesn’t create the install rule. Use this config value if you need to install files that are generated as part of your build process, like HTML files created by qdoc.
If set, the typical Unix strip functionality is turned off and the debug information will remain in the binary.
On Unix, this sets the executable flag.

When you do a make install, and you don't have a build of the project yet, the project is first built, and then installed. If you don't want this behavior, set this config value to ensure that the build target is not added as a dependency to the install target.

A project has a top-level project target where, when you do a make install, everything is installed. But, if you have an install target with this config value set, it's not installed by default. You then have to explicitly say make install_<file>.

db:section.db:para: For more information, see Installing Files.
This variable is also used to specify which additional files will be deployed to embedded devices.

db:section.db:title: JAVA_HOME

db:note.db:para: This variable is useful only to Android targets.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the JDK/OpenJDK installation path used for building the project.

db:section.db:title: LEXIMPLS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of Lex implementation files. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: LEXOBJECTS
db:section.db:para: Specifies the names of intermediate Lex object files. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: LEXSOURCES
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of Lex source files. All dependencies, headers and source files will automatically be added to the project for building these lex files.
For example:

db:section.db:title: LIBS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of libraries to be linked into the project. If you use the Unix -l (library) and -L (library path) flags, qmake handles the libraries correctly on Windows (that is, passes the full path of the library to the linker). The library must exist for qmake to find the directory where a -l lib is located.
For example:
To specify a path containing spaces, quote the path using the technique described in Whitespace.
By default, the list of libraries stored in LIBS is reduced to a list of unique names before it is used. To change this behavior, add the no_lflags_merge option to the CONFIG variable:

db:section.db:title: LIBS_PRIVATE
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of libraries to be linked privately into the project. The behavior of this variable is identical to LIBS, except that shared library projects built for Unix do not expose these dependencies in their link interface.

The effect of this is that if project C depends on library B which depends on library A privately, but C also wants to use symbols from A directly, it needs to link to A explicitly. Put differently, libraries linked privately are not exposed transitively at build time.

db:section.db:title: LITERAL_HASH
db:section.db:para: This variable is used whenever a literal hash character (#) is needed in a variable declaration, perhaps as part of a file name or in a string passed to some external application.
For example:
db:section.db:programlisting: # To include a literal hash character, use the $$LITERAL_HASH variable: urlPieces = http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtextdocument.html pageCount message($$join(urlPieces, $$LITERAL_HASH))
db:section.db:para: By using LITERAL_HASH in this way, the # character can be used to construct a URL for the message() function to print to the console.

db:section.db:title: MAKEFILE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the generated Makefile. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: MAKEFILE_GENERATOR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the Makefile generator to use when generating a Makefile. The value of this variable is typically handled internally by qmake and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: MSVCPROJ_*
db:section.db:para: These variables are handled internally by qmake and should not be modified or utilized.

db:section.db:title: MOC_DIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the directory where all intermediate moc files should be placed.
For example:

db:section.db:title: OBJECTIVE_HEADERS
db:section.db:para: Defines the Objective-C++ header files for the project.
qmake automatically detects whether moc is required by the classes in the headers, and adds the appropriate dependencies and files to the project for generating and linking the moc files.
This is similar to the HEADERS variable, but will let the generated moc files be compiled with the Objective-C++ compiler.
See also OBJECTIVE_SOURCES.

db:section.db:title: OBJECTIVE_SOURCES
db:section.db:para: Specifies the names of all Objective-C/C++ source files in the project.
This variable is now obsolete, Objective-C/C++ files (.m and .mm) can be added to the SOURCES variable.
See also OBJECTIVE_HEADERS.

db:section.db:title: OBJECTS
db:section.db:para: This variable is automatically populated from the SOURCES variable. The extension of each source file is replaced by .o (Unix) or .obj (Win32). You can add objects to the list.

db:section.db:title: OBJECTS_DIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the directory where all intermediate objects should be placed.
For example:

db:section.db:title: POST_TARGETDEPS
db:section.db:para: Lists the libraries that the target depends on. Some backends, such as the generators for Visual Studio and Xcode project files, do not support this variable. Generally, this variable is supported internally by these build tools, and it is useful for explicitly listing dependent static libraries.
This list is placed after all builtin (and $$PRE_TARGETDEPS) dependencies.

db:section.db:title: PRE_TARGETDEPS
db:section.db:para: Lists libraries that the target depends on. Some backends, such as the generators for Visual Studio and Xcode project files, do not support this variable. Generally, this variable is supported internally by these build tools, and it is useful for explicitly listing dependent static libraries.
This list is placed before all builtin dependencies.

db:section.db:title: PRECOMPILED_HEADER
db:section.db:para: Indicates the header file for creating a precompiled header file, to increase the compilation speed of a project. Precompiled headers are currently only supported on some platforms (Windows - all MSVC project types, Apple - Xcode, Makefile, Unix - gcc 3.3 and up).

db:section.db:title: PWD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the full path leading to the directory containing the current file being parsed. This can be useful to refer to files within the source tree when writing project files to support shadow builds.
See also _PRO_FILE_PWD_.

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.

db:section.db:title: OUT_PWD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the full path leading to the directory where qmake places the generated Makefile.

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.

db:section.db:title: QM_FILES_RESOURCE_PREFIX
db:section.db:para: Specifies the directory in the resource system where .qm files will be made available by CONFIG += embed_translations.
The default is :/i18n/.

db:section.db:title: QM_FILES_INSTALL_PATH
db:section.db:para: Specifies the target directory .qm files generated by CONFIG += lrelease will be installed to. Does not have any effect if CONFIG += embed_translations is set.

db:section.db:title: QML_IMPORT_PATH
db:section.db:para: This variable is only used by Qt Creator. If you have an extra module that is kept outside of your Qt installation, you can specify its path here.
See Qt Creator: Using QML Modules with Plugins for details.

db:section.db:title: QMLPATHS
db:section.db:para: Expects a list of import paths that point to root directories of trees of QML modules. For example, if you have a custom location for your QML modules, you can specify it here.

db:note.db:para: The path entries for QMLPATHS point to root directories of trees of QML modules. This is the concept of import paths the QML engine understands. You can pass the same paths via the QML_IMPORT_PATH environment variable to your QML application, but they are different from the expected contents of the QML_IMPORT_PATH qmake variable. The latter expects paths to individual modules to be processed by Qt Creator only.

The contents of QMLPATHS are not automatically passed to your application. Rather, they are only used at build time. In particular, qmlimportscanner uses them to find any QML modules it may need to mark as imported by your application.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the qmake program itself and is placed in generated Makefiles. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKESPEC
db:section.db:para: A system variable that contains the full path of the qmake configuration that is used when generating Makefiles. The value of this variable is automatically computed.

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_APPLE_DEVICE_ARCHS

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of architectures to build for. By default, a project is built for the development machine's architecture. This variable allows to override the default and build for a different architecture or to create multi-architecture binaries.
This variable is usually specified on the command line or in the project file.
See Qt for macOS for more information.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_AR_CMD

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the command to execute when creating a shared library. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_BUNDLE_DATA

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the data that will be installed with a library bundle, and is often used to specify a collection of header files.
For example, the following lines add path/to/header_one.h and path/to/header_two.h to a group containing information about the headers supplied with the framework:
db:section.db:programlisting: FRAMEWORK_HEADERS.version = Versions FRAMEWORK_HEADERS.files = path/to/header_one.h path/to/header_two.h FRAMEWORK_HEADERS.path = Headers QMAKE_BUNDLE_DATA += FRAMEWORK_HEADERS
db:section.db:para: The last line adds the information about the headers to the collection of resources that will be installed with the library bundle.
Library bundles are created when the lib_bundle option is added to the CONFIG variable.
See Platform Notes for more information about creating library bundles.
A project can also use this variable to bundle application translation files. The exact syntax depends on whether the project is using Xcode's legacy build system or its new build system.
For example when the following project snippet is built using the legacy build system:

Xcode will ignore the original location of InfoPlist.strings and the file will placed into the bundle Resources directory under the provided translations_en.path path, so Resources/en.lproj/InfoPlist.strings
With the new build system, the relative location of the file is preserved, which means the file will incorrectly be placed under Resources/en.lproj/en.lproj/InfoPlist.strings
To ensure correct file placement, the project can either move the original file not to be in a sub-directory or it can choose not to specify the translations_en.path variable.
db:section.db:programlisting:
# Approach 1 translations_en.files = $$PWD/InfoPlist.strings translations_en.path = en.lproj
# Approach 2 translations_de.files = $$PWD/de.lproj/InfoPlist.strings
QMAKE_BUNDLE_DATA += translations_en translations_de
db:section.db:para: See QTBUG-98417 for more details on how the Xcode build system changed its behavior in bundling translation files.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_BUNDLE_EXTENSION

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the extension to be used for library bundles. This allows frameworks to be created with custom extensions instead of the standard .framework directory name extension.
For example, the following definition will result in a framework with the .myframework extension:

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CC
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C compiler that will be used when building projects containing C source code. Only the file name of the compiler executable needs to be specified as long as it is on a path contained in the PATH variable when the Makefile is processed.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C compiler flags for building a project. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified. The flags specific to debug and release modes can be adjusted by modifying the QMAKE_CFLAGS_DEBUG and QMAKE_CFLAGS_RELEASE variables, respectively.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_DEBUG
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C compiler flags for debug builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_RELEASE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C compiler flags for release builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_RELEASE_WITH_DEBUGINFO
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C compiler flags for release builds where force_debug_info is set in CONFIG. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_SHLIB

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the compiler flags for creating a shared library. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_THREAD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the compiler flags for creating a multi-threaded application. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_WARN_OFF
db:section.db:para: This variable is used only when the warn_off CONFIG option is set. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CFLAGS_WARN_ON
db:section.db:para: This variable is used only when the warn_on CONFIG option is set. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CLEAN
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of generated files (by moc and uic, for example) and object files to be removed by make clean.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXX
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler that will be used when building projects containing C++ source code. Only the file name of the compiler executable needs to be specified as long as it is on a path contained in the PATH variable when the Makefile is processed.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for building a project. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified. The flags specific to debug and release modes can be adjusted by modifying the QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_DEBUG and QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_RELEASE variables, respectively.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_DEBUG
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for debug builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_RELEASE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for release builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_RELEASE_WITH_DEBUGINFO
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for release builds where force_debug_info is set in CONFIG. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_SHLIB
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for creating a shared library. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_THREAD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for creating a multi-threaded application. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_WARN_OFF
db:section.db:para: Specifies the C++ compiler flags for suppressing compiler warnings. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_CXXFLAGS_WARN_ON
db:section.db:para: Specifies C++ compiler flags for generating compiler warnings. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_DEVELOPMENT_TEAM

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: The identifier of a development team to use for signing certificates and provisioning profiles.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_DISTCLEAN
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of files to be removed by make distclean.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXTENSION_SHLIB
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension for shared libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:note.db:para: Platform-specific variables that change the extension override the contents of this variable.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXTENSION_STATICLIB
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension for shared static libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_MOC
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on included moc files.
See also File Extensions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_UI
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on Qt Widgets Designer UI files.
See also File Extensions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_PRL
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on created PRL files.
See also File Extensions, Library Dependencies.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_LEX
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on files given to Lex.
See also File Extensions, LEXSOURCES.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_YACC
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on files given to Yacc.
See also File Extensions, YACCSOURCES.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_OBJ
db:section.db:para: Contains the extension used on generated object files.
See also File Extensions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_CPP
db:section.db:para: Contains suffixes for files that should be interpreted as C++ source code.
See also File Extensions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXT_H
db:section.db:para: Contains suffixes for files which should be interpreted as C header files.
See also File Extensions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXTRA_COMPILERS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of additional compilers or preprocessors.
See also Adding Compilers.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_EXTRA_TARGETS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of additional qmake targets.
See also Adding Custom Targets.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_FAILED_REQUIREMENTS
db:section.db:para: Contains the list of failed requirements. The value of this variable is set by qmake and cannot be modified.
See also requires() and REQUIRES.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_FRAMEWORK_BUNDLE_NAME

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: In a framework project, this variable contains the name to be used for the framework that is built.
By default, this variable contains the same value as the TARGET variable.
See Creating Frameworks for more information about creating frameworks and library bundles.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_FRAMEWORK_VERSION

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: For projects where the build target is a macOS, iOS, tvOS, or watchOS framework, this variable is used to specify the version number that will be applied to the framework that is built.
By default, this variable contains the same value as the VERSION variable.
See Creating Frameworks for more information about creating frameworks.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_HOST
db:section.db:para: Provides information about the host machine running qmake. For example, you can retrieve the host machine architecture from QMAKE_HOST.arch.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the list of system header paths that are appended to INCLUDEPATH. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR_EGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of EGL header files to be added to INCLUDEPATH when building a target with OpenGL/ES or OpenVG support. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR_OPENGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of OpenGL header files to be added to INCLUDEPATH when building a target with OpenGL support. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenGL implementation uses EGL (most OpenGL/ES systems), then QMAKE_INCDIR_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR_OPENGL_ES2
db:section.db:para: This variable specifies the location of OpenGL header files to be added to INCLUDEPATH when building a target with OpenGL ES 2 support.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenGL implementation uses EGL (most OpenGL/ES systems), then QMAKE_INCDIR_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR_OPENVG
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of OpenVG header files to be added to INCLUDEPATH when building a target with OpenVG support. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenVG implementation uses EGL then QMAKE_INCDIR_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INCDIR_X11

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of X11 header file paths to be added to INCLUDEPATH when building an X11 target. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_INFO_PLIST

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the property list file, .plist, you would like to include in your macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS application bundle.
In the .plist file, you can define some variables which qmake will replace with the relevant values:

db:td.db:para: Expands to the target bundle's bundle identifier string, for example: com.example.myapp. Determined by concatenating the values of QMAKE_TARGET_BUNDLE_PREFIX and QMAKE_BUNDLE, separated by a full stop (.). The value of QMAKE_BUNDLE is derived from QMAKE_APPLICATION_BUNDLE_NAME, QMAKE_PLUGIN_BUNDLE_NAME, or QMAKE_FRAMEWORK_BUNDLE_NAME. It should not be set directly by the project.

Equivalent to the value of QMAKE_APPLICATION_BUNDLE_NAME, QMAKE_PLUGIN_BUNDLE_NAME, or QMAKE_FRAMEWORK_BUNDLE_NAME (depending on the type of target being created), or TARGET if none of the previous values are set.
Expands to the value of ICON.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_PKGINFO_TYPEINFO.
Expands to the value of VERSION expressed with three version components.
Expands to the value of VERSION expressed with two version components.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_TVOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_WATCHOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET.
Expands to the value of QMAKE_IOS_LAUNCH_SCREEN.

db:note.db:para: When using the Xcode generator, the above ${var}-style placeholders are replaced directly by the Xcode build system and are not handled by qmake. The @var@ style placeholders work only with the qmake Makefile generators and not with the Xcode generator.

db:section.db:para: If building for iOS, and the .plist file contains the key NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription, qmake will include an additional plugin to the build that adds photo access support (to, e.g., QFile/QFileDialog). See Info.plist documentation from Apple for more information regarding this key.

db:note.db:para: Most of the time, the default Info.plist is good enough.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_IOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on the iOS platform only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the hard minimum version of iOS that the application supports.
For more information, see Expressing Supported iOS Versions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_IOS_LAUNCH_SCREEN

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on the iOS platform only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the launch screen that is used by the application. If this is not set then a default launch screen is used.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a general set of flags that are passed to the linker. If you need to change the flags used for a particular platform or type of project, use one of the specialized variables for that purpose instead of this variable.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_CONSOLE

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Windows only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for building console programs. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_DEBUG
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for debug builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_PLUGIN
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for building plugins. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_RPATH

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags needed to use the values from QMAKE_RPATHDIR.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_REL_RPATH
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags needed to enable relative paths in QMAKE_RPATHDIR.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_REL_RPATH_BASE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the string the dynamic linker understands to be the location of the referring executable or library.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_RPATHLINK
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags needed to use the values from QMAKE_RPATHLINKDIR.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_RELEASE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for release builds. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_RELEASE_WITH_DEBUGINFO
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for release builds where force_debug_info is set in CONFIG. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_APP
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for building applications. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_SHLIB
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags used for building shared libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_SONAME
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for setting the name of shared objects, such as .so or .dll. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_THREAD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for building multi-threaded projects. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LFLAGS_WINDOWS

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Windows only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker flags for building Windows GUI projects (that is, non-console applications). The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of library search paths for all projects. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
To specify additional search paths in project files, use LIBS like that, instead:

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_POST
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of system library search paths for all projects. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_FLAGS

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of all library directories with -L prefixed. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_EGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of the EGL library directory, when EGL is used with OpenGL/ES or OpenVG. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_OPENGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of the OpenGL library directory. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenGL implementation uses EGL (most OpenGL/ES systems), then QMAKE_LIBDIR_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_OPENVG
db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of the OpenVG library directory. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenVG implementation uses EGL, then QMAKE_LIBDIR_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBDIR_X11

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the location of the X11 library directory. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS
db:section.db:para: Specifies additional libraries each project needs to link against. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
To specify libraries in a project file, use LIBS instead.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_PRIVATE
db:section.db:para: Specifies additional private libraries each project needs to link against. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
To specify private libraries in a library project file, use LIBS_PRIVATE instead.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_EGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies all EGL libraries when building Qt with OpenGL/ES or OpenVG. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified. The usual value is -lEGL.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_OPENGL
db:section.db:para: Specifies all OpenGL libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenGL implementation uses EGL (most OpenGL/ES systems), then QMAKE_LIBS_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_OPENGL_ES1, QMAKE_LIBS_OPENGL_ES2
db:section.db:para: These variables specify all the OpenGL libraries for OpenGL ES 1 and OpenGL ES 2.
The value of these variables is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.
If the OpenGL implementation uses EGL (most OpenGL/ES systems), then QMAKE_LIBS_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_OPENVG
db:section.db:para: Specifies all OpenVG libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified. The usual value is -lOpenVG.

Some OpenVG engines are implemented on top of OpenGL. This will be detected at configure time and QMAKE_LIBS_OPENGL will be implicitly added to QMAKE_LIBS_OPENVG wherever the OpenVG libraries are linked.
If the OpenVG implementation uses EGL, then QMAKE_LIBS_EGL may also need to be set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_THREAD

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies all libraries that need to be linked against when building a multi-threaded target. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIBS_X11

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies all X11 libraries. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LIB_FLAG
db:section.db:para: This variable is not empty if the lib template is specified. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LINK
db:section.db:para: Specifies the linker that will be used when building application based projects. Only the file name of the linker executable needs to be specified as long as it is on a path contained in the PATH variable when the Makefile is processed. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LINK_SHLIB_CMD
db:section.db:para: Specifies the command to execute when creating a shared library. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LN_SHLIB
db:section.db:para: Specifies the command to execute when creating a link to a shared library. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_LRELEASE_FLAGS
db:section.db:para: List of additional options passed to lrelease when enabled through CONFIG += lrelease.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_OBJECTIVE_CFLAGS
db:section.db:para: Specifies the Objective C/C++ compiler flags for building a project. These flags are used in addition to QMAKE_CFLAGS and QMAKE_CXXFLAGS.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_POST_LINK
db:section.db:para: Specifies the command to execute after linking the TARGET together. This variable is normally empty and therefore nothing is executed.

db:note.db:para: This variable takes no effect on Xcode projects.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_PRE_LINK
db:section.db:para: Specifies the command to execute before linking the TARGET together. This variable is normally empty and therefore nothing is executed.

db:warning.db:para: This variable is not supported when using the Xcode generator and the new Xcode build system.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_PROJECT_NAME

db:note.db:para: This variable is used for Visual Studio project files only.

db:section.db:para: Determines the name of the project when generating project files for IDEs. The default value is the target name. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_PROVISIONING_PROFILE

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS only.

db:section.db:para: The UUID of a valid provisioning profile. Use in conjunction with QMAKE_DEVELOPMENT_TEAM to specify the provisioning profile.

db:note.db:para: Specifying the provisioning profile disables the automatically managed signing.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_MAC_SDK
db:section.db:para: This variable is used on macOS when building universal binaries.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on the macOS platform only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the hard minimum version of macOS that the application supports.
For more information, see macOS Supported Versions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_MAKEFILE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the Makefile to create. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_QMAKE
db:section.db:para: Contains the absolute path of the qmake executable.

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RESOURCE_FLAGS
db:section.db:para: This variable is used to customize the list of options passed to the Resource Compiler in each of the build rules where it is used. For example, the following line ensures that the -threshold and -compress options are used with particular values each time that rcc is invoked:

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RPATHDIR

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on Unix platforms only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of library paths that are added to the executable at link time so that the paths will be preferentially searched at runtime.

When relative paths are specified, qmake will mangle them into a form understood by the dynamic linker to be relative to the location of the referring executable or library. This is supported only by some platforms (currently Linux and Darwin-based ones) and is detectable by checking whether QMAKE_REL_RPATH_BASE is set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RPATHLINKDIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of library paths for the static linker to search for implicit dependencies of shared libraries. For more information, see the manual page for ld(1).

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RUN_CC
db:section.db:para: Specifies the individual rule needed to build an object. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RUN_CC_IMP
db:section.db:para: Specifies the individual rule needed to build an object. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RUN_CXX
db:section.db:para: Specifies the individual rule needed to build an object. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_RUN_CXX_IMP
db:section.db:para: Specifies the individual rule needed to build an object. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_SONAME_PREFIX
db:section.db:para: If defined, the value of this variable is used as a path to be prepended to the built shared library's SONAME identifier. The SONAME is the identifier that the dynamic linker will later use to reference the library. In general, this reference may be a library name or full library path. On macOS, iOS, tvOS, and watchOS, the path may be specified relatively using the following placeholders:

db:td.db:para: Expands to paths defined by LC_RPATH mach-o commands in the current process executable or the referring libraries.
Expands to the current process executable location.
Expands to the referring executable or library location.

db:section.db:para: In most cases, using @rpath is sufficient and recommended:
However, the prefix may be also specified using different placeholders, or an absolute path, such as one of the following:
For more information, see dyld documentation on dynamic library install names.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the project target. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_COMPANY
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the company for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the company name in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_DESCRIPTION
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the description for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the description in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_COPYRIGHT
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the copyright information for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the copyright information in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_PRODUCT
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the product for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the product in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_ORIGINAL_FILENAME
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the original file name for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the original file name in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_INTERNALNAME
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the internal name for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the internal name in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_COMMENTS
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the comments for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the comments in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TARGET_TRADEMARKS
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the trademark information for the project target; this is used where applicable for putting the trademark information in the application's properties. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_MANIFEST
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the manifest file for the project target. This is only utilized if the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set. Don't forget to remove embed_manifest_exe and embed_manifest_dll from the CONFIG variable, otherwise it will conflict with the compiler generated one.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_TVOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on the tvOS platform only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the hard minimum version of tvOS that the application supports.
For more information, see Expressing Supported iOS Versions.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_UIC_FLAGS
db:section.db:para: This variable is used to customize the list of options passed to the User Interface Compiler in each of the build rules where it is used.

db:section.db:title: QMAKE_WATCHOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET

db:note.db:para: This variable is used on the watchOS platform only.

db:section.db:para: Specifies the hard minimum version of watchOS that the application supports.
For more information, see Expressing Supported iOS Versions.

db:section.db:title: QML_IMPORT_MAJOR_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Specifies the major version to be used for automatically generated QML type registrations. For more information, see Defining QML Types from C++.

db:section.db:title: QML_IMPORT_MINOR_VERSION
db:section.db:para: When automatically registering QML types defined in C++, register an additional version of the module using this minor version. Generally, minor versions to be registered are inferred from the meta objects.

You can use this variable if the meta objects have not changed and you still want to import a QML module with a newer minor version number. For example, MyModule metaobjects are at 1.1 level, but you want to import the module as 1.3.

db:section.db:title: QML_IMPORT_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Specifies QML_IMPORT_MAJOR_VERSION and QML_IMPORT_MINOR_VERSION as a <major>.<minor> version string.

db:section.db:title: QML_IMPORT_NAME
db:section.db:para: Specifies the module name to be used for automatically generated QML type registrations. For more information, see Defining QML Types from C++.

db:section.db:title: QML_FOREIGN_METATYPES
db:section.db:para: Specifies further JSON files with metatypes to be considered when generating qmltypes files. Use this when external libraries provide types that are exposed to QML, either directly or as base types or properties of other types. Qt types will automatically be considered and don't have to be added here.

db:section.db:title: QT
db:section.db:para: Specifies the Qt modules that are used by your project. For the value to add for each module, see the module documentation.
At the C++ implementation level, using a Qt module makes its headers available for inclusion and causes it to be linked to the binary.
By default, QT contains core and gui, ensuring that standard GUI applications can be built without further configuration.
If you want to build a project without the Qt GUI module, you need to exclude the gui value with the "-=" operator. The following line will result in a minimal Qt project being built:
db:section.db:programlisting: QT -= gui # Only the core module is used.
db:section.db:para: If your project is a Qt Widgets Designer plugin, use the value uiplugin to specify that the project is to be built as a library, but with specific plugin support for Qt Widgets Designer. For more information, see Building and Installing the Plugin.

db:section.db:title: QTPLUGIN
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of names of static Qt plugins that are to be linked with an application so that they are available as built-in resources.

qmake automatically adds the plugins that are typically needed by the used Qt modules (see QT). The defaults are tuned towards an optimal out-of-the-box experience. See Static Plugins for a list of available plugins, and ways to override the automatic linking.
This variable currently has no effect when linking against a shared/dynamic build of Qt, or when linking libraries. It may be used for deployment of dynamic plugins at a later time.

db:section.db:title: QT_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Contains the current version of Qt.

db:section.db:title: QT_MAJOR_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Contains the current major version of Qt.

db:section.db:title: QT_MINOR_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Contains the current minor version of Qt.

db:section.db:title: QT_PATCH_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Contains the current patch version of Qt.

db:section.db:title: RC_FILE
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the name of the Windows resource file (.rc) for the target. See Adding Windows Resource Files.

db:section.db:title: RC_CODEPAGE
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the codepage that should be specified in a generated .rc file. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: RC_DEFINES
db:section.db:para: Windows only. qmake adds the values of this variable as RC preprocessor macros (/d option). If this variable is not set, the DEFINES variable is used instead.

db:section.db:title: RC_ICONS
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the icons that should be included into a generated .rc file. This is only utilized if the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variable are not set. More details about the generation of .rc files can be found in the Platform Notes.

db:section.db:title: RC_LANG
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the language that should be specified in a generated .rc file. This is only utilized if the VERSION or RC_ICONS variable is set and the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set.

db:section.db:title: RC_INCLUDEPATH
db:section.db:para: Specifies include paths that are passed to the Windows Resource Compiler.

db:section.db:title: RCC_DIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the directory for Qt Resource Compiler output files.
For example:

db:section.db:title: REQUIRES
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of values that are evaluated as conditions. If any of the conditions is false, qmake skips this project (and its SUBDIRS) when building.

db:note.db:para: We recommend using the requires() function instead if you want to skip projects or subprojects when building.

db:section.db:title: RESOURCES
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the resource collection files (qrc) for the target. For more information about the resource collection file, see The Qt Resource System.

db:section.db:title: RES_FILE
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the name of the Windows resource compiler's output file for this target. See RC_FILE and Adding Windows Resource Files.
The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: SOURCES
db:section.db:para: Specifies the names of all source files in the project.
For example:
See also HEADERS.

db:section.db:title: SUBDIRS
db:section.db:para: This variable, when used with the subdirs template specifies the names of all subdirectories or project files that contain parts of the project that need to be built. Each subdirectory specified using this variable must contain its own project file.

It is recommended that the project file in each subdirectory has the same base name as the subdirectory itself, because that makes it possible to omit the file name. For example, if the subdirectory is called myapp, the project file in that directory should be called myapp.pro.
Alternatively, you can specify a relative path to a .pro file in any directory. It is strongly recommended that you specify only paths in the current project's parent directory or its subdirectories.
For example:
If you need to ensure that the subdirectories are built in a particular order, use the .depends modifier on the relevant SUBDIRS elements.
For example:
db:section.db:programlisting: SUBDIRS += my_executable my_library tests doc my_executable.depends = my_library tests.depends = my_executable
db:section.db:para: The configuration above ensures that my_library is built before my_executable and that my_executable is built before tests. However, doc can be built in parallel with the other subdirectories, thus speeding up the build process.

db:note.db:para: Multiple dependencies can be listed and they will all be built before the target that depends on them.
Using CONFIG += ordered is discouraged as it can slow down multi-core builds. Unlike the example shown above, all builds will happen sequentially even if they don't have dependencies.

db:section.db:para: Beside defining the build order, it is possible to modify the default behavior of SUBDIRS by giving additional modifiers to SUBDIRS elements. Supported modifiers are:

db:td.db:para: Use the specified subdirectory instead of SUBDIRS value.
Specify the subproject pro file explicitly. Cannot be used in conjunction with .subdir modifier.
This subproject depends on specified subproject(s).
The makefile of subproject. Available only on platforms that use makefiles.
Base string used for makefile targets related to this subproject. Available only on platforms that use makefiles.

db:section.db:para: For example, define two subdirectories, both of which reside in a different directory than the SUBDIRS value, and one of the subdirectories must be built before the other:
db:section.db:programlisting: SUBDIRS += my_executable my_library my_executable.subdir = app my_executable.depends = my_library my_library.subdir = lib

db:section.db:title: TARGET
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the target file. Contains the base name of the project file by default.
For example:
db:section.db:programlisting: TEMPLATE = app TARGET = myapp SOURCES = main.cpp
db:section.db:para: The project file above would produce an executable named myapp on unix and myapp.exe on Windows.

db:section.db:title: TARGET_EXT
db:section.db:para: Specifies the extension of TARGET. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: TARGET_x
db:section.db:para: Specifies the extension of TARGET with a major version number. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: TARGET_x.y.z
db:section.db:para: Specifies the extension of TARGET with a version number. The value of this variable is typically handled by qmake or qmake.conf and rarely needs to be modified.

db:section.db:title: TEMPLATE
db:section.db:para: Specifies the name of the template to use when generating the project. The allowed values are:

db:td.db:para: Creates a Makefile for building applications (the default). See Building an Application for more information.
Creates a Makefile for building libraries. See Building a Library for more information.
Creates a Makefile for building targets in subdirectories. The subdirectories are specified using the SUBDIRS variable.
Creates a Makefile for not building anything. Use this if no compiler needs to be invoked to create the target; for instance, because your project is written in an interpreted language.

db:note.db:para: This template type is only available for Makefile-based generators. In particular, it will not work with the vcxproj and Xcode generators.

db:td.db:para: Windows only. Creates an application project for Visual Studio. See Creating Visual Studio Project Files for more information.
Windows only. Creates a library project for Visual Studio.

db:section.db:para: For example:
db:section.db:programlisting: TEMPLATE = lib SOURCES = main.cpp TARGET = mylib
db:section.db:para: The template can be overridden by specifying a new template type with the -t command line option. This overrides the template type after the .pro file has been processed. With .pro files that use the template type to determine how the project is built, it is necessary to declare TEMPLATE on the command line rather than use the -t option.

db:section.db:title: TRANSLATIONS
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of translation (.ts) files that contain translations of the user interface text into non-native languages.
Translation files in TRANSLATIONS will be processed by both lrelease and Using lupdate tools. Use EXTRA_TRANSLATIONS if you want only lrelease to process a file.
You can use CONFIG += lrelease to automatically compile the files during the build, and CONFIG += lrelease embed_translations to make them available in The Qt Resource System.
See the Qt Linguist Manual for more information about internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) with Qt.

db:section.db:title: TR_EXCLUDE
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of paths (source files, subdirectories, and C++ include paths) to be excluded from handling in lupdate. The paths may contain wildcards. Relative paths are considered to be relative to _PRO_FILE_PWD_.
For example, to exclude source files:
To exclude subdirectories of a SUBDIRS project:
db:section.db:programlisting: SUBDIRS += \ libs \ apps \ tests TR_EXCLUDE += tests
db:section.db:para: To speed up lupdate's C++ parser, exclude include paths:

db:section.db:title: UI_DIR
db:section.db:para: Specifies the directory where all intermediate files from uic should be placed.
For example:

db:section.db:title: VERSION
db:section.db:para: Specifies the version number of the application if the app template is specified or the version number of the library if the lib template is specified.

On Windows, triggers auto-generation of an .rc file if the RC_FILE and RES_FILE variables are not set. The generated .rc file will have the FILEVERSION and PRODUCTVERSION entries filled with major, minor, patch level, and build number. Each number must be in the range from 0 to 65535. More details about the generation of .rc files can be found in the Platform Notes.
For example:

db:section.db:title: VERSION_PE_HEADER
db:section.db:para: Windows only. Specifies the version number, that the Windows linker puts into the header of the .exe or .dll file via the /VERSION option. Only a major and minor version may be specified. If VERSION_PE_HEADER is not set, it falls back to the major and minor version from VERSION (if set).

db:section.db:title: VER_MAJ
db:section.db:para: Specifies the major version number of the library if the lib template is specified.

db:section.db:title: VER_MIN
db:section.db:para: Specifies the minor version number of the library if the lib template is specified.

db:section.db:title: VER_PAT
db:section.db:para: Specifies the patch version number of the library if the lib template is specified.

db:section.db:title: VPATH
db:section.db:para: Tells qmake where to search for files it cannot open. For example, if qmake looks for SOURCES and finds an entry that it cannot open, it looks through the entire VPATH list to see if it can find the file on its own.
See also DEPENDPATH.

db:section.db:title: WINDOWS_TARGET_PLATFORM_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Specifies the targeted Windows version; this corresponds to the tag WindowsTargetPlatformVersion in vcxproj files.
On desktop Windows, the default value is the value of the environment variable WindowsSDKVersion.

db:section.db:title: WINDOWS_TARGET_PLATFORM_MIN_VERSION
db:section.db:para: Specifies the minimum version of the Windows target platform; this corresponds to the tag WindowsTargetPlatformMinVersion in vcxproj files.
Defaults to WINDOWS_TARGET_PLATFORM_VERSION.

db:section.db:title: YACCSOURCES
db:section.db:para: Specifies a list of Yacc source files to be included in the project. All dependencies, headers and source files will automatically be included in the project.
For example:

db:section.db:title: _PRO_FILE_
db:section.db:para: Contains the path to the project file in use.
For example, the following line causes the location of the project file to be written to the console:

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.

db:section.db:title: _PRO_FILE_PWD_
db:section.db:para: Contains the path to the directory containing the project file in use.
For example, the following line causes the location of the directory containing the project file to be written to the console:

db:note.db:para: Do not attempt to overwrite the value of this variable.
